page.title: 04 ---Chilton Village-1925----
page.content: The people in the village, although poor, did have employment at one of the 3 racing stables or 3 farms near the village. The staple diet of villagers was lamb tail pie,rook pie, rabbit pie, streaky bacon and cheese. The village had 1 public house, the Rose and Crown, in the name of Edwards. Mrs.Edwards was from the Vinton family. The school had 2 classes. Once a week children were taken by taxi to Harwell- the boys to do woodwork, the girls to do cookery. The children played games like tip-cat, spinning top, hop-scotch and hide and seek. Villagers were able to visit Didcot twice a week or Abingdon once a week by bus, but the roads were very poor.There was a local train service to Newbury.
